features.description: Supports using a different certificate authority per certificate.

list.title: Let's Encrypt
list.summary: The most popular ACME certificate authority, issuing free 90 day certificates including wildcards, with up to 100 subject names per cert.
cons: Rate limits apply (hard - not user changeable)
Using an ECDSA-only chain requires opt-in via allow-list

list.title: ZeroSSL
list.summary: The second most popular ACME certificate authority, issuing free 90 day certificates including wildcards, with up to 100 subject names per cert.
list.description: The ZeroSSL service is operated by Stack Holdings in Vienna and is related to apilayer.com. They have actively sponsored development of several open-source ACME clients including Caddy and acme.sh.
cons: Rate limits apply (hard - not user changeable)
Requires external account binding (EAB) for account registration
Service is currently free, commonly raising questions of how the parent company will eventually monetize the service.

list.title: BuyPass
list.summary: ACME certificate authority, issuing free 180 day certificates with up to 5 subject names.
pros: Longer expiry (180 days) can be useful where deployment automation is limited
cons: Rate limits apply (hard - not user changeable)
Certificate feature are limited in comparison (SAN limit and no wildcards)

list.title: SSL.com
list.summary: ACME certificate authority, issuing free 90 day certificates including 1 subject name and a www. variant.
pros: Longer expiry (180 days) can be useful where deployment automation is limited
cons: Requires external account binding (EAB) for account registration
Certificate feature are very limited in comparison (1 domain and no wildcards)
